"Citizen": "Oh, Lady Harriet! What brings you here?"
"Ah, you cannot call her that anymore! You must address her as this nation's monarch!"
"Oh, that's right! You're our nation's ruler now, Lady Harriet!"
"That's...!"
"Hehe. I'm still new and inexperienced as the monarch of this nation, so Harriet will do just fine."
"Lady Harriet! Lady Harriet! What's a monarch?"
"Hmm... I suppose you could say that a monarch is a representative of all their people."
"Are they great? Are they amazing?"
"They're neither. They are just like everyone else, only they stand out more."
"Hmm, Lady Harriet likes to stand out?"
"Err... yes, I do! That said, it is a little embarrassing to do this on my own. Would you all be happy to support me?"
"Yeah! Of course!"
"Yeah!"
"Lady Harriet!"
"Lady Harriet!"
"Lady Harriet."
"Lady Harriet!"
"So many people are flocking here... They must really idolize you."
"Idolized by my people... that's different."
"Prime Minister Lutz... no, the former king, placed burdens on the people to preserve the capital..."
"They are excited to be free of his tyranny. And I think that they are expressing their hopes regarding the way I am to govern them."
"Besides which, I have been visiting this city in secret since I was but a child, and I am known to many of the townsfolk."
"The people know their monarch, and thus their minds are at ease."
"Thus, they support us and we have an obligation to respond to their troubles."
"It is the first step in rebuilding this nation. It is the duty of a royal to make their people happy."
"However, there is one other thing that we must do if we wish to regain the trust of the people."
"That is the aim towards which Luther and I have been working. The elimination of Ephimera."
